column1: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson One?
column2: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column3: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:  Crimson One is an Australian construction business that builds residential properties in Australia. The business has around 300 employees. Crimson One has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits and start employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income Australian suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However several Australian house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.

column1: I think the behavior is disgusting. They are taking advantage of their customers.
they are untethical and cheap
I think that they are sleazy, and that their practices should reduce their market share.
I think the behavior is unacceptable and are too greedy.
I mostly think its foolish and short sighted.  There are obviously some moral issues, but its hard for me to focus on those when a successful company is making a high-risk/low-reward decision.
I THINK IT IS AWFUL. THEY TOOK ADVANTAGE OF THE PEOPLE WHO PURCHASED THE HOUSES.

I find it deplorable. Cutting costs on material for profits just makes the situation worse for your customers. It is a companys obligation to provide the best service possible. In the case of construction work cutting corners is potentially dangerous to the customer.
Crimson One is definitely defrauding people with the use of cheap products where home buyers tend to spend more than expected on home repair.
I think that it is unethical and could be considered crimial.
I dont think it was an ethical decision.
awful, they’re hurting people who are already hurting.
I think this is very unethical behavior, it violates all possible laws and should be punished properly.

In the short term, it made sense. They saved a lot of money using cheaper materials to build. However, in the long term, it didnt. Not only do the owners of the homes Crimson One built now have to pay more for costly repairs, Crimson Ones reputation is now damaged.
I feel that they will get a bad reputation for using lower quality materials and in the long run, this will hurt them as being cheap builders.
I think its not uncommon in todays world, but personally find it unethical and - intentionally or not - racially biased because it is often people of color who live in lower economic areas.

I think it is horrible and they sound like really bad people. I dont think what they did was right and I question their moral. I think that they probably need to either be sued or the need to go to jail.  I think their actions will one day end up hurting people.
Crimson One has put profit in front of integrity. They are greedy and do not truly care about all of their costumers. I feel this is a bad business decision and a bad business practice.
I think the behavior of Crimson One is reprehensible. They are very greedy and dont respect their customers.
I think it is unethical and immoral that the business used shoddy and cheap building materials requiring tenants to spend more money to repair.
I think it is misleading and dishonest of them. Awful business standards
I think their behavior is deceptive. If they are going to use cheaper building materials they should admit it before people buy their homes.
Crimson One got greedy. They put profits ahead of quality.

I think it a stupid decision on their part. They are trying to make more money by being cheap with the houses they build. It is also not fair to the people that are purchasing these homes. They are going to end up losing lots of business because they are going to create a bad name for themselves by being so selfish
I think it is unethical and very irresponsible.

Poor choice was made. Using subpar materials results in damage and repair costs. You get what you pay for. Construction company will,probably spend more money fixing things than if they had done it right the first time!
I feel that their behavior is unprofessional and cheap, and they should have known better.
Using cheap material for construction of houses is not ethical
They are selfish, they have their interest at heart and not that of their client

I think its greedy and selfish that they would use cheaper building materials so they can make more of a profit. Its hurtful to the people that own the properties and will have to pay to make repairs later on.

Personally, I feel the company has become greedy. But at the same the, the thought buyer beware comes to mind. Since the company mainly builds for low income, I do believe they are taking advantage. What also enters my thought is who actually is sponsoring this effort, a country, town, charity organization? In reality I believe it is their responsibility to make sure this company does not cut corners, otherwise I believe their efforts are insincere.
I think that it is a disgusting practice based on greed.

Greed -- It would seem that Crimson One is more concerned about money (greed) than producing a quality product; especially since they did this in low-income houses.  Eventually, this poor decision will come back to them and hurt their business.
I think they are just greedy and their behavior is terrible since they are making cheap houses
cheap, unethical, criminal, killer mentality towards others, cheating
I think that the behavior of Crimson One is very shady and unethical because they are cutting corners and not giving their clients their best work.

this practice is legal, but it will have an affect on the companys reputation. the scenario did not say if the houses built with lower quality  materials were sold for the same price as expensive suburban homes. if the subject houses sold for less, then you can say the customers received what they paid for.

I feel that by going using cheaper building materials, Crimson One is being extremely unethical. These residents are already low-income and now it will cost them in the future where it would not have if the construction company used proper materials in the first place.
I think it is deplorable.
I think it is immoral and wrong.   It takes advantage of the poor.
Financially, for the company, it may mean bigger profits. However, the company is being dishonest and unfair with their practices and providing the public with an inferior product.
It is unethical and deceitful.
Unacceptable behavior that should be investigated and they should pay for the cost that the owners occurred.
Crimson one doing has the worst behavior
They are very unethical.
I think Crimson One is unethical. They should be sued for every dollar they caused in damage for using cheap materials.

the business decided to maximize profits by using inferior products to build. It was and is now concerned with only the bottom line. It has sold out to only make money, not to build a quality building
They are greedy and irresponsible.
I think it’s sad but also think it’s realistic to choose profit over morals

Unfortunately it is a reality of life. Cheaper houses will be constructed using the cheapest materials. It appears the government should impose the acceptable standards for human dwelling construction projects.

I think that in order to make more money (as opposed to savings money), they resorted to cheap building materials. Crimson One knew that their lowest income customers would be buying these homes, the type of customers who are least able to make expensive repairs.
THEY ARE AWARE OF THE BOTTOM LINE AND HOPE TO CONTINUE BUILDING LOW COST HOUSING WHILE STAYING AHEAD OF THE COSTS INVOLVED
Its a loser company that puts profits over people.  They dont care about quality at all.
They are somewhat unethical. if you know people will be forced to pay more in the long run at least put that in the building material(dont know if they did)
I do not like it but find it to be typical in order to produce a cheaper product and higher profits.
I think they are focused on profit and saving money rather than focusing on qualtity and long term success.
It seems immoral if they didnt communicate with the buyer the quality of the housing that they were selling.
I think that what Crimson One did is something that a lot of companies do. They want to cut costs where they can, and it obviously has a negative impact down the road.
I thank that it was unacceptable. People are trusting someone to build there house. If you are not going to do it to your best ability then dont do something.
it is normal
i dont like the fact that they started using cheap materials.  it is very bad for the company.
Their behavior is unethical and reprehensible
I don’t like this decision that they made.  The must not be guided by principles of integrity and consistency.
I believe Crimson is acting cheap when they are doing good financially and can afford higher quality materials.
As long as it is legal, and meets all existing codes, there is no problem with their decision to use cheaper materials.
Seems nefarious, but its not surprising.
Wrong and unethical. Using cheaper materials caused homeowners more money in the long run.

I think Crimson Ones behavior is unethical. By using cheap materials, they not only guaranteed that the homeowner would run into repair situations and costs, it might even have been dangerous to the homeowners in some way.
I think that in trying to cut corners, theyve actually wasted more money. I think its bad, but a lot of companies do this and its not unusual

Nothing in particular, if they dont lower prices enough to convince real estate developers and home buyers its worthwhile to purchase their lower quality products then theyll eventually run into issues. I would assume the benefit of the cheaper materials is that they can underbid other constructions companies, and then the inference to be made by the people ultimately buying their services is that the quality is potentially inferior.  You need to explain whether the price paid for the home is entirely offset by the incremental maintenance costs for a decision to be reached. It seems quite possible that a lower purchase price could be a net benefit to lower income areas, despite some necessary maintenance. I suppose all you academics care about is propagating some greed narrative, regardless of any actual net outcomes.
bad business
I think it is reprehensible as it hurts people who can least afford to fix their houses just because crimson one used cheaper building materials.
It is bad business strategy

I think its a behavior that will not work out for them in the long run.  In the short term they are saving money and making more profits, but as the inferior materials are discovered and the story gets out in the press it will hurt their business.  They will lose their reputation and clients and make less profits in the long term.
Crimson one is successful but they are not conscious of their decisions and the impact that their cheap materials have on the lives of others.
I think their behavior is unacceptable and was wrong to cut corners just to make more money.
That they use underhanded business practices to gain profit. They dont appear to have good moral standing as business owners.

I think it degrades their reputation. By importing cheap materials instead of using the quality ones they were once known for, they are going to lose customers in the future after word of mouth gets out about the poor quality of their newer properties. I think this is poor behavior and a detrimental business model.
It is unethical and wrong. They should keep using good quality materials
Irresponsible and greedy. In using cheaper materials, theyve passed the buck to the consumer. Pure greed.
I think that the construction company should use the same building materials on all projects
I think it isnt fair to the ones staying there. Yes crimson is benefiting from it but its causing the lie income to suffer more
I think it is unethical and just downright disgusting. Corporate businesses will do anything to make money and it doesnt matter how it affects the consumer.
I think this is pretty unethical if they are passing off the cheaper materials as he materials they were using before while charging the same prices.
I think it’s a bad behavior. They are skimping of material which will then lead to problems for the home owner.
I had a feeling that using cheaper materials would come back to haunt Crimson One and it looks like I was right.
think its a cheap way for them to make money, but unfortunately happens way too often
I think they decided profits was more important than integrity

I believe that the practice of using cheaper materials is unethical. If they are knowingly using lower quality materials in certain areas of building order to make a profit, that is wrong. They are not only lowering their standards for profit, they are also misleading potential customers.
It is disgusting behavior, though not unheard of. Profit over the safety of someones home is a pretty gross thing to benefit from.
I dont like that they did that
It is unethical, but savvy
It is immoral
I think its bad
Crimson One has more concern with economic gain than moral values for other people!

Using lower quality materials is never good for anyone - the consumer or the company. It hurts everyone and I do not think the companies behavior was good in any way. Profit over safety and quality is never a good thing for anyone.
I think it was a good business idea, but a bad moral decision.
Its bad. They are using worse materials to make more money for themselves and screw over the people who live in their buildings in the longrun.
I think the behavior of Crimson One is immoral. They are selfish and only care about themselves. Its a lousy business model and one that probably will end up destroying them in the end.
I think its unethical and should be corrected.
they are in business for the profit
I think it was wrong to start using cheaper quality products. Their actions impacted innocent people.
It was bad to use the cheaper materials that will affect the quality of the buildings.
They are selfish and dont care about their customers!
a shameful thing to do, but they are not the only ones doing business like that these days
reprehensible profit mongering
It isnt right or moral
I understand the desire to have greater profit but to do it at the expense of the poor is not very good.  Cutting corners with peoples lives, poor or not, is not in the best interest of anyone.
Unethical
I think it’s not very honest and they are padding their pockets at the expense of people who can’t afford to fix their mistakes.

I think it is unfortunate that companies have cut corners to sell an less than quality product which leads to consumers having higher costs to improve the conditions that should have already been standard
I THINK CRIMSON ONE IS VERY IRRESPONSIBLE AND IMMORAL IN THEIR BUSINESS. THEIR ACTIONS ARE PUTTING A LOT OF LIVES IN DANGER BY THEIR USE OF CHEAP AND LOW QUALITY PRODUCTS.
I think it is poor business practice to intentionally use lesser quality materials.
i think it is immoral and unethical.
I do not like that type of business behavior, it seems unethical.
I think the behavior of Crimson One is deplorable because it offloads negative consequences into the futures of lower-power stakeholders.
Its reprehensible. Their business practices will hurt them and their customers in the long run.
Its pretty unethical to make cheaper houses but Im sure others do it too. Its still unethical.
I dont approve of course. Theyve hurt the community they serve by lowering the quality of their materials, and the welfare of the community is more important than their bottom line
